subject: Nutrition
title: How Supermarkets Trick You
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Supermarkets Trick You usable.

hook.text: Supermarkets place milk at the back so you walk past every aisle. Every layout choice is designed to sell.

buildup.text: Eye-level shelves hold the most expensive products. Cheaper alternatives hide on the bottom shelf.

discovery.text: End-cap displays increase product sales by 30% even without any actual price reduction.

twist.text: The bakery smell piped through stores isn't always from fresh bakingâ€”some use artificial scent machines.

climax.text: The average shopper makes 60% of purchasing decisions inside the store, driven by design, not planning.

punchline.text: Supermarkets are designed to override your shopping list.

quiz.question: What percentage of purchasing decisions happen inside the store?
